sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 3, 5} and B = {2, 3, 4}. Find the Cartesian product of (A Δ B) and B, where Δ represents the symmetric difference between sets A and B. Show that the Cartesian product of (A Δ B) and B is not equal to the Cartesian product of (B Δ A) and A.
